summary: This document is a chain of emails from April 2023 between Daniel Ruzumna, an attorney for the Epstein Estate, and a prosecutor from the SDNY's Public Corruption Unit. The emails concern two matters: 1) reporting a video containing suspected child pornography discovered during document review for litigation against JPMorgan and Deutsche Bank, and 2) requesting access to a specific HP computer seized from Epstein's Little St. James property. The prosecutor connects Ruzumna with the lead FBI and NYPD investigators on the case.

persons.name: Daniel Ruzumna
persons.context: Attorney from Patterson Belknap Webb & Tyler LLP representing Richard Kahn, a co-executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate. He is communicating with the SDNY to report suspected child pornography and request access to a seized computer.

events.title: Initial Request for Computer Access
events.description: Daniel Ruzumna sends an email requesting access to a specific HP computer seized from Epstein's Little St. James property.

events.title: Discovery of Suspected Child Pornography
events.description: Daniel Ruzumna reports that a document reviewer for the Epstein Estate found a video that may contain child pornography while reviewing materials for litigation against JPMorgan and Deutsche Bank.

events.title: SDNY Coordinates with Investigators
events.description: A prosecutor from the SDNY Public Corruption Unit responds, connecting Ruzumna with the lead FBI and NYPD investigators on the Epstein case to handle the child pornography report and the computer access request.

locations: New York, NY 10036 (Patterson Belknap law firm address)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (United States Attorney's Office, SDNY)
keyFacts: In April 2023, a document reviewer for the Epstein Estate discovered a video suspected to contain child pornography while reviewing materials for civil litigation against JPMorgan and Deutsche Bank.
The Epstein Estate's attorney was seeking access to a specific HP computer seized from the "generator room" on Epstein's private island, Little St. James.
The SDNY's Public Corruption Unit facilitated contact with the lead FBI and NYPD investigators from the original Epstein case to handle these new matters.
The correspondence confirms ongoing legal and investigative activity related to Epstein's estate and seized evidence years after his death.
